Subject: Seeds and orders in JMX calls
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=291412925

I'm exploring the JMX interface for remote control of Heritrix in more dept=
h.

The 'addJob' method takes a "seed" parameter, which presumably is a lis=
t of seeds to use for the crawl. I assumed that I could give the path to an=
 order file and the list of seeds in this argument, and Heritrix would crea=
te the seeds.txt file for me. But this isn't the case (at least in CVS HEAD=
). It would appear that in addition to the path to the order you have to ha=
ve the seeds file in place so that the reference in the order can find it. =
What then is the purpose of the seeds param in the JMX interface?

I notice=
d that you can pass the path to a JAR file containing the order and seed fi=
les. How do I refer to the seeds in the order so that they will be found?

=
I looked around the Wiki for descriptions of these APIs, but didn't really =
find anything.

Thanks in advance,

    -tree
